page.title: 16The Rye Harbour Lifeboat.
page.content: The lifeboat is an {inshore}one which doesn't go right out to sea .If there is someone in trouble at sea they call Dungeness or Hastings because the boats are much larger.The lifeboat is worth {Â£10,000 to Â£15,000. The present lifeboat is 5 years old.A new boathouse has been built.It was opened in{July 1985.}It has been painted and fitted by members of the crew. {The Lifeboat Supporters Group {***************************} The lifeboat has got a ladies supporters group who raise money by having coffee mornings and evenings, jumble sales and discos.The group meets monthly and consists mainly of wives of the lifeboat{crew or close {relatives.}Recently the group raised Â£400 for a ship to shore radio.
